summary: "Vertigo" is a classic 1958 thriller by Alfred Hitchcock about a retired police detective, played by James Stewart, who fears heights due to a past incident. He becomes a private investigator and follows the mysterious wife of an acquaintance, played by Kim Novak. The film was shot in beautiful locations around San Francisco and used a unique camera technique called the "dolly zoom" to show the character's fear. Although it had mixed reviews at first, "Vertigo" is now considered one of the best movies ever made.
title: Vertigo (film)
